properties.areaDesc: Polk; Hardee; Inland Manatee; DeSoto; Highlands
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 2 at 4:53PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay Ruskin FL
properties.description:
At 452 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along
a line extending from near Intercession City to near Lake Wales to 7
miles southeast of Myakka City. Movement was east at 40 mph.

Wind gusts up to 50 mph will be possible with these storms.

Locations impacted include...
Lake Wales, Sebring, Avon Park, Wauchula, Lake Placid, Ona, Sylvan
Shores, Lake Istokpoga, Sebring Regional Airport, Poinciana,
Sweetwater, Fort Meade, Crooked Lake Park, Frostproof, Bowling Green,
Zolfo Springs, Hillcrest Heights, Highland Park, Alturas and Indian
Lake Estates.
properties.instruction:
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms, and may lead
to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded
roadways.

Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms.
Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe
shelter inside a building or vehicle.

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR NORTHWESTERN HIGHLANDS... HARDEE...SOUTHEASTERN MANATEE...EASTERN POLK AND NORTHERN DESOTO COUNTIES UNTIL 545 PM EDT

properties.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 2 at 4:50PM EDT expiring November 2 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Melbourne FL
properties.description:
At 449 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado
was located 4 miles west of Windermere, moving east at 45 mph.

HAZARD...Tornado.

SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.

IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without
shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage
to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur.  Tree damage is
likely.

This dangerous storm will be near...
Ocoee, Winter Garden and Windermere around 455 PM EDT.
Oak Ridge, Orlovista and Universal Studios around 500 PM EDT.

Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include
Minneola.
properties.instruction:
TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors or in a vehicle,
move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from
flying debris.

Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the
tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!

NWSheadline: A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL LAKE AND WESTERN ORANGE COUNTIES

properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 2 at 4:49PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
properties.description:
* At 449 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were
tracking a strong thunderstorm over Belle Glade, moving east at 30
mph.

* Winds in excess of 45 mph possible with this storm.

* Locations impacted include...
Wellington, Belle Glade, Pahokee, South Bay, Canal Point,
Okeelanta, Belle Glade Camp, Lion Country Safari Park, Fremd
Village-Padgett Island and Loxahatchee NWR.
properties.instruction:
These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around
unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the
storm passes.

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR CENTRAL PALM BEACH COUNTY UNTIL 530 PM EDT

properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued November 2 at 4:48PM EDT expiring November 2 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville FL
properties.description:
At 447 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hastings,
moving northeast at 30 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees.

Locations impacted include...
Saint Augustine, Hastings, Saint Augustine Shores, Butler Beach,
Saint Augustine South, Crescent Beach, Spuds, Dupont Center and
Elkton.
properties.instruction:
For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

Intense thunderstorms can produce brief tornadoes and widespread
significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately
likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of
a building. This storm may cause serious injury and significant
property damage.

NWSheadline: A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN ST. JOHNS COUNTY

properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 2 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville FL
properties.description:
At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over
Juniper Springs, moving northeast at 25 mph.

Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph can be expected along with possible minor
wind damage.

Locations impacted include...
Salt Springs, Juniper Springs, Lynne, Weirsdale, Ocklawaha, Moss
Bluff, Silver Springs Shores, Lake Weir and Burbank.
properties.instruction:
To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement
agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service
office in Jacksonville.

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SOUTHEASTERN MARION COUNTY UNTIL 515 PM EDT

properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 2 at 4:36PM EDT by NWS Melbourne FL
properties.description:
At 434 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms
across central Lake county to the Four Corners area, moving
northeast at 45 mph.

Wind gusts up to 55 mph will be possible with these storms. Minor
wind damage may accompany these storms as they move through the area.

Locations impacted include...
Orlando, Kissimmee, Apopka, Ocoee and Winter Garden.
properties.instruction:
Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm, and may lead
to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded
roadways.

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR CENTRAL LAKE...WESTERN ORANGE AND NORTHWESTERN OSCEOLA COUNTIES UNTIL 530 PM EDT

centered near Satsuma, or near Palatka, moving east at 30 mph.

Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph can be expected along with possible minor
wind damage.

Locations impacted include...
Palm Coast, Saint Augustine, Palatka, Bunnell, Crescent City,
Interlachen, Pomona Park, Hastings, Melrose and East Palatka.
properties.instruction:
To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement
agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR EASTERN ALACHUA...NORTHERN FLAGLER...ST. JOHNS...NORTHEASTERN MARION...PUTNAM AND SOUTHERN CLAY COUNTIES UNTIL 500 PM EDT

properties.areaDesc: Coastal Wakulla; Coastal Bay; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; South Walton
properties.headline: Rip Current Statement issued November 2 at 5:40AM EDT expiring November 3 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
properties.description:
* SURF HEIGHTS...2 to 5 feet.

* Impacts...The surf and frequent rip currents will be very
dangerous and life threatening for all level of swimmers.
properties.instruction:
A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in
the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion and
dangerous swimming conditions.

There is a high risk of rip currents.

Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away
from shore, which occur most often at low spots or breaks in the
sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as groins, jetties
and piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards, beach patrol flags and
signs.

If you become caught in a rip current, yell for help. Remain
calm, do not exhaust yourself and stay afloat while waiting for
help. If you have to swim out of a rip current, swim parallel to
shore and back toward the beach when possible. Do not attempt to
swim directly against a rip current as you will tire quickly.

NWSheadline: HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING

properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued November 1 at 7:55PM EDT expiring November 6 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Tampa Bay Ruskin FL
properties.description:
* RED TIDE HAZARDS...Possible respiratory irritation in some
coastal areas.

For red tide forecast information visit
https://tidesandcurrents.noaa.gov/hab/gomx.html

* FLORIDA RED TIDE RESPIRATORY IRRITATION POTENTIAL IMPACTS...
Symptoms may include coughing...sneezing...and tearing eyes.
People with respiratory conditions such as asthma...
emphysema...and other pulmonary diseases may be more
sensitive. Irritation may vary locally and throughout the day.
If you experience uncomfortable symptoms...consider going to
an unaffected beach nearby.

* FLORIDA RED TIDE RESPIRATORY IRRITATION TIMING/LOCATION...NOAA
FORECAST:...Coastal southern Pinellas County: Gulf coast and bay
regions...possible Friday and Saturday. Coastal
northern/southern Manatee County: bay regions...possible Friday
and Saturday. Gulf coast of southern Manatee...possible Friday
and Saturday. Coastal northern/southern Sarasota County: Gulf
coast...possible Friday and Saturday. Bay regions of northern
Sarasota...possible Friday and Saturday.
properties.instruction:
Florida red tide observations...You can find unaffected beaches
by checking reports of recent local observations and data: Mote
Marine Laboratory daily beach conditions at
https://visitbeaches.org and the Florida Fish and Wildlife
Conservation Commission (FWC) red tide status at
myfwc.com/redtidestatus.

Florida red tide health information...Consult the Florida
Department of Health at: www.floridahealth.gov/environmental-
health/aquatic-toxins/red-tide.html or call the Poison Control
Center at: 1 800 222 1222.

Inclusion of external links does not constitute endorsement by
the Department of Commerce (DOC)/(NOAA) of these external web
sites or the information, products, or services contained
therein.

Florida red tide information sources...red tide forecasts are
provided by the National Ocean Service with data provided by the
FWC and Mote Marine Laboratory.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING
